meanings.definition: The state or quality of being invalid.
meanings.sent1: The invalidity of the document was evident.
meanings.sent2: The judge declared the invalidity of the contract.
meanings.sent3: The invalidity of the excuse made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her argument crumbled under the weight of its own invalidity.
meanings.sent5: The invalidity of his claim was as clear as day.

meanings.definition: The condition of being legally or officially invalid.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer argued for the invalidity of the will.
meanings.sent2: The invalidity of the license was a major issue.
meanings.sent3: The invalidity of the parking ticket was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: The invalidity of the contract was a red flag for the company.
meanings.sent5: The invalidity of the decision left everyone in shock.
